cyclone.name: DELTA
cyclone.current_location: about 130 miles south of Negril, Jamaica
cyclone.trajectory: accelerating northwest across the north-western Caribbean and southeastern Gulf of Mexico toward the north-central Gulf Coast, with the core aimed at Louisiana late in the work-week
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Louisiana coast (likely south-central, between Morgan City and Grand Isle)

port.name: Port of Greater Baton Rouge, LA

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch in effect only for portions of western Cuba; no U.S. Gulf coast watches yet
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical Storm Warning for the Cayman Islands (far from Louisiana)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire central U.S. Gulf Coast from Texas upper coast eastward through Louisiana and Mississippi is within the 5-day cone of uncertainty
weather_observation.storm_surge_above_3_feet: Unlikely at the port location (inland), though greater surge is expected along the immediate Louisiana coast
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force gusts possible at the port late Thursday night through Friday as the system moves inland; peak sustained winds 35–45 mph with higher gusts if the track remains near Baton Rouge
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected directly at the port (80+ mi upriver), but higher river stages and backwater effects are possible from coastal surge
weather_observation.rainfall: 4–8 inches of rainfall possible Friday–Saturday with localized higher totals, creating flash-flood risk and elevated river flows that can disrupt terminal operations
weather_observation.other_hazards: Brief tornadoes in outer rainbands, rapid river level rise, and possible power outages affecting cargo handling equipment
